::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**SF1.2 Groundwater ecosystems**](/efg-info/SF1_2.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/SF1_2_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: SF1.2.web.orig v1.0.

> Indicative global maps of Groundwater aquifers were based on Bundesanstalt für Geowissenschaften und Rohstoffe & UNESCO (2012) with colour ramp showing type of aquifer by recharge rate, only in major groundwater basins (type 11 (minor occurrences) to type 15 (major occurrences)).

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**BGR-Groundwater-Basins** (Bundesanstalt für Geowissenschaften und Rohstoffe  BGR):

Source of _topography and geomorphology_.
 Resolution: >1km2, static.
 Accuracy evaluation: derived from sources.

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset                |url                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|:----------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|BGR-Groundwater-Basins |<https://www.whymap.org/whymap/EN/Maps_Data/Rgwb/rgwb_node_en.html>{target='links'} :: <https://www.un-igrac.org/sites/default/files/resources/files/RiverBasins_GroundwaterResources_Map_ExplanatoryNotes.pdf>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *NA*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Coarse quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Direct,specific*.

Ground observations are _NA_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Compiled from reputable source data,documented,qualitative*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Indicative Map (**code: SF1.2.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: SF1.2.web.orig**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**SF1.2.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/SF1.2.IM.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

**SF1.2.web.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/SF1.2.web.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091045){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](https://github.com/red-list-ecosystem/typology-map-data/blob/master/data/layers/SF1.2.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](layers/SF1.2.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](SF1.2.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map might have some restriction for commercial use, see details below.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}

:::

## References

References used in this version of the maps.

- Bundesanstalt für Geowissenschaften und Rohstoffe (BGR) & UNESCO (2012) **River and Groundwater Basins of the World** 1 : 50 000 000 – Hannover, Paris
